results.title: A Place for everything
results.creator_credit: Eric M Nilsson, Svenska filminstitutet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Eric Nilsson examines the attitudes of Swedish young people, and others critical of the well-ordered society. The established institutions are considered to be inflexible, and lacking in dynamism. A plea is made for independence, imagination, and more discussion of existing conditions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric M Nilsson, Svenska filminstitutet and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Place to live: building in Maine
results.creator_credit: Fred James and Lumen Bel Productions
results.brief_description: This film shows how Pat and Patsy Hennim of Maine, U.S., adapt different building theories to build their own home in the woods, minimising on costs and maximising on living conditions. In turn they teach their ideas to a group of students.

results.title: A Piece of the action
results.creator_credit: Sidney Poitier, Melville Tucker, Warner Bros Pictures and First Artists
results.brief_description: Bill Cosby and Sidney Poitier star as Dave and Manny, two Chicago crooks who have independently made a bundle ripping off rip-off artists who exploit the poor. But they have no intention of giving to the poor, until ex-Detective Burke pulls a con of his own - he anonymously gives the pair a choice, to donate time to a Community Centre or do time in a federal prison. Scrambling in their off-hours to find out who is blackmailing them, the two spend their working hours in classroom confrontations reminiscent of Poitier’s “To Sir With Love,” with 30 troubled ghetto kids. Cast includes James Earl Jones, Hope Clarke and Ja’net Du Bois.

results.title: A Piece of cake = Cest pas chinois
results.creator_credit: Jacques Bobet, Pierre Heberrt, Gilles Gascon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The effortless style of the champion gymnast seems a piece of cake. Made without commentary, this film begins with eager young people going through their exercises in a school gymnasium and concludes with an exhibition of faultless gymnastics at the 1973 China-Canada competitions.

results.title: A Place to land
results.creator_credit: Ivern Hendrickson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A review of the great occasions in aviation history in Australia, followed by a report on the planning, construction and opening of the new international air terminals at Sydney’s Kingsford-Smith Airport and Tullamarine, Victoria.

results.title: A personal retrospective of World War II
results.brief_description: The second world war as seen from the perspective of a soldier who enlisted in 1941, with film clips from the period. Presented by Stuart Glover. Suitable for school years 10 to 12.

results.title: A Perfect world
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Mark Johnson and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Eight year old Phillip, the son of a devout Jehovah’s witness mother, is staying home while all other children are out trick-or-treating. The next morning their home is broken into by prison escapee Butch Haynes, who needing a hostage to aid his escape from jail, grabs Phillip and flees. Phillip curiously looks up to Butch and willingly accompanies him as they take to Texas highway on the run from the cops. Butch is not particularly anxious to make it to the Texas border, being more concerned about fulfilling Phillip’s prohibited wants and dreams. Texas Ranger Red Garnett is not in any hurry to catch Butch either. As Butch and Phillip form a father-son relationship, the paths of Butch and Garnett gradually come together in time for a final confrontation. Cast includes Kevin Costner, Clint Eastwood, Laura Dern and T.J. Lowther.

results.title: A Pathological anxiety
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description: A presentation of psychoneurotic conditions. Examines the effect of mental disorder on behaviour, using as an illustration the case history of an office worker whose efforts to suppress his hostility result in a sense of terror and panic which prevents him from leading a normal life. Filmed at Montreal General Hospital with Dr A. H. Marcus and Dr Nathan B. Epstein.

results.title: A Place to begin: St Andrews by the Northern Sea
results.creator_credit: Mark Littlewood, Films of Scotland and Pelicula
results.brief_description: St. Andrews, once the ecclesiastical capital of the country, has the oldest university in Scotland, and is the headquarters of the Royal & Ancient Golf Club. The film shows the town, past and present.

results.title: A Pace ahead
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Australian Dairy Board
results.brief_description: Research is the basis for new and improved products from the dairy industry. Experimental farms test new breeds of cattle, pastures and fodder harvesting and conservation. Shows milk production, butter making, cheese making, and the by-products of casein and malt, and considers the nearby eastern countries as a tremendous market.
